text: some hubdb feedback: It’d be nice to mimic Shopify’s bulk editor with multi-select/edit options.
Are there plans to make a name column sticky? When there are 10+ columns, users have been entering the information in the wrong rows because they get lost.
We are actively working on some UI improvements to make editing data faster
Sweet! I have to sneak this in there then... Having the ability to choose what columns are visible and save views would be killer

one thing that’s been hotly requested which would be nice is a form like view for the hubDB that would make adding a row, be like filling out a normal form. This is good for HubDB’s that have tons of content per row, or for example ones that have multiple rich text fields
also for those who need to add items but they dont want them to be in the DB

Cool. It’s pretty easy to overwhelm the current UI in the multi-select columns. It looks like it only shows about 3 rows of data before it says to “click to see more”. And when it’s expanded, you can’t scroll up/down, plus it doesn’t show all values. And if you click in the wrong spot, it will jump you all the way back to the first column.
BUG: This keeps happening and is making me tear out my hair
yeah, I’m getting that too. It looks like it’s not constrained to multi-select columns, just large tables in general.
Can you send me a link to the table?
